intro: Gentiana laevicalyx, commonly known as the Chinese gentian, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are tubular with five lobes and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects. Gentiana laevicalyx is also valued in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
